metadata.title: CVE-2016-6187 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The apparmor_setprocattr function in security/apparmor/lsm.c in the Linuxkernel before 4.6.5 does not validate the buffer size, which allows localusers to gain privileges by triggering an AppArmor setprocattr hook.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6187` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
